pages.text_verbatim_title_block:
WADDELL ENGINEERING LTD.
To: Susanne Murchison; City of Kawartha Lakes; CBO
From: Sam DesRoches, Waddell Engineering Ltd.
Project: 30x168 Dog Kennel Lintel & Timber
Location: 146 Yankee Line, Omemee, ON, K0L 2W0
Project No.: 25-01-096
STRUCTURAL MEMO
Friday, January 17, 2025
pages.general_notes_verbatim:
To whom it may concern,
Waddell Engineering Ltd. has been retained to provide a structural review of the design for the project mentioned above.
Background:
During a recent site inspection completed by a third-party inspector, it was noted that a timber porch was installed at one of the entrances supported by an existing 6-foot span 2x10 lintel. The inspector was concerned that this existing lintel will not be able to support the additional loads from the timber porch and has requested that an engineer review the lintel and porch structures. The following figure displays the lintel location as well as the timber porch design.
pages.page_overview_summary: This page is a structural memo from Waddell Engineering Ltd. regarding a review of a lintel and timber porch design for a dog kennel. It provides background information on the project and highlights concerns about the existing lintel's ability to support additional loads. The page includes a figure showing the lintel and porch location.

pages.drawing_title: Timber Porch Design and Existing Lintel Size
pages.text_verbatim_title_block:
WADDELL ENGINEERING LTD.
STRUCTURAL MEMO
Friday, January 17, 2025
pages.general_notes_verbatim:
Design Loads:
The following design loads were used for the review of the existing lintel and the timber porch. The existing lintel is highlighted in Figures 1 and 2 above.
Dead Load = 0.55 kPa
Live Load = 1.41 kPa
pages.page_overview_summary: This page provides detailed drawings of the timber porch design and the existing lintel size. It includes specifications for timber framing and design loads used in the review. The design loads are specified as 0.55 kPa for dead load and 1.41 kPa for live load.

pages.text_verbatim_title_block:
WADDELL ENGINEERING LTD.
STRUCTURAL MEMO
Friday, January 17, 2025
pages.general_notes_verbatim:
Design Results:
The existing 3 ply 2x10 lintel is able to support both the existing loads and the timber porch point load addition. No changes need to be made.
Comments:
It is the opinion of Waddell Engineering Ltd. that the design is structurally adequate and agrees with the Ontario Building Code.
Any questions or comments can be directed to the writer.
Regards,
Sam DesRoches P.Eng.
pages.page_overview_summary: This page presents the design results, confirming that the existing 3 ply 2x10 lintel can support the loads without requiring changes. The design is deemed structurally adequate and compliant with the Ontario Building Code. Contact information for further inquiries is provided.

pages.page_overview_summary: This page outlines the limitations and disclaimers associated with the structural memo. It specifies that the report is intended solely for the client and disclaims liability for third-party use. The report is based on limited investigation and does not include environmental assessments. Waddell Engineering Ltd. relies on client-provided information and disclaims responsibility for inaccuracies resulting from such information.
